import { Container } from '../../style'; const TeacherPartnership = () => { return (

What is Tagpros Education Marketplace?

A digital learning community called Tagpros Education Marketplace provides K–12 students with a range of small-sized, additional after-school online sessions.

By investigating and learning about topics that the students find intriguing, we offer an option to help disengaged students rekindle their love and passion for learning while allowing dedicated instructors the flexibility and freedom to teach in novel and innovative ways.

To learn more about this unique platform, visit{' '} www.tagpros.us

 

What is Tagpros Teacher Partnership?

Through the Tagpros Teacher Partnership program, we can connect and collaborate with educators who have the skills and desire to work as online instructors on the Tagpros Education marketplace and platform. The goal of this alliance is to give teachers the tools they need to design and deliver online courses to learners who are also looking for alternate ways to acquire the new skills they will need for their academic and personal development journeys. Through this collaboration, teachers can make money while providing excellent online instruction at their own convenience.

Tagpros Teacher Partners undergo a 2-step application and onboarding process:

  • Apply and submit as a Teacher Partner. We will assess applications and check if they meet the professional and technical requirements.
  • Start publishing your classes. Create your online classes, submit them for approval, and get ready to teach online students in your class.

Apply as a Tagpros Teacher Partner at:{' '} https://tagpros.us/

 

What are the professional requirements for Teacher Partnership?

Professional Requirements

We welcome online teachers from many different backgrounds! That being said, we have a few requirements that must be met to become and remain a teacher on Tagpros:

  • Be at least 18 years of age
  • Reside full-time in the Philippines or possess Filipino citizenship.
  • Must have a Bachelor’s degree or higher for academic classes (a valid diploma or proof of graduation must be provided)
  • Must have a Portfolio (can be in a form of a website or professional blog) for non-academic classes
  • Maintain a good command of written and spoken English
  • For teachers, submit valid PRC ID; for non-teachers, submit a valid government-issued ID (with photo and signature)
  • Base your classes around one or more of your expertise or passion.
  • Capacity to teach in an online class/environment
  • Meet our Community Standards, including prompt, professional communication with parents and the Tagpros team.{' '}
  • Observe our Class Content Policy, including the policy that Tagpros classes are secular and objective.

 

What are the technical requirements for Teacher Partnership?

Technical Requirements

  • A laptop or desktop computer
  • For live classes:{' '}
    • A webcam (at least 480 pixels) and microphone
    • Environment conducive for learning (room, lighting, and background)
    • a minimum upload speed of 3mbps and a minimum download speed of 1mbps Broadband, DSL, or high-speed wifi{' '}
  • Most recent versions of Safari, Chrome, Firefox, or Edge

 

How to apply as a Tagpros Teacher Partner:

Partnership Application and Onboarding Process

Get to Know Tagpros

First, understand how it works. Consult our Teacher Guide. We also have a Facebook Group of prospective teachers. (https://www.facebook.com/groups/290205165695142/)

Step 1: Apply

Follow the instructions to register on www.tagpros.us and submit an application. You must provide us with information about yourself and make a sample video of your teaching. Make sure to fill us in on all the specifics of your teaching background, your knowledge of the subjects you'd like to teach, and your contributions to the platform.

Check the step-by-step visual guide on how to apply as a Tagpros Teacher Partner:{' '} (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G0oVSkYuGnM)

Background Check

If your application meets our standards, we will ask you to submit an NBI clearance. Once your background check is completed, your request to teach will be approved.

Step 2: Start Publishing Your Classes

Once you are approved to teach, we will invite you to schedule an optional one-on-one welcome call with an existing Tagpros teacher to help you get started.

You will now be able to:

  • Create your online classes. class listings and schedule sections.
  • Submit your classes for review. Wait for approval.
  • Once approved, get ready to teach learners from around the world!

 

How to start our classes? What do I need to prepare for the live classes?

Some reminders to help you get ready in conducting your online classes:

  • Make sure that your lesson plan and learning activities are ready.
  • Log in 5-10 minutes before the beginning of your class. Make sure that the technical needs, such as the Internet connection, proper lighting, background, and others are ready and functioning well.
  • Check attendance and take note of absent students. Use the Tagpros Attendance Google Form Link.
  • Reserve 5-10 minutes of your class to get to know your students and check with them.
  • Smile and make the students feel safe and comfortable in your online class.
  • Always use respectful words and gestures. Always keep in mind that there might be an adult (parent, siblings, or guardian) beside the student during the class.
  • In case of emergency (loss of Internet connection, power outage, etc), call or send a message to the following hotlines: __________ (Phone number) or send an email to:{' '} customercare@tagpros.us. {' '}

 

Who will identify the time? What will be the time of the class (US time and Phil time)?

The teacher will identify the best time to conduct the online classes. Please be mindful of time and date differences if you aim to get online students from the USA. Check this link for reference:{' '} USA - Philippine Timezone Reference

 

Who will identify the pricing of each class? How much will I earn? Will it be per class or per head? How will the payment be to the Teacher Partners?

The teacher will be paid for each learner in his or her class. The teacher can select the price of his or her class from a range of prices recommended by Tagpros.{' '} The teacher earns 70% of net revenues from the class . The amounts paid to the teacher are considered the teacher’s professional fees, so applicable taxes are withheld in accordance with Philippine tax regulations.{' '}

The teacher is paid after a grace period from the end of the last session of the class, usually lasting a week but can last up to 30 days. Payouts are made through PayPal, hence teachers are required to create PayPal accounts.

A sample computation of a teacher’s payout is given below

Number of students in the class: 5
Listed price per student: USD 50
Number of sessions: 3 Hours per session: 1 hr

Gross Amount (5 students x USD 50) 250
Less: VAT (12%) (26.79)
Net Amount (shared between Tagpros and teacher) 223.21
Less: Tagpros’ share in Net Amount (30%) (66.96)
Teacher’s share in Net Amount 156.25
Less: Withholding income taxes (10% of teacher’s share in net amount) (15.63)
Credit to teacher’s account 140.62
); }; export default TeacherPartnership;
